definition: to visit/to call on/to seek/to inquire/to investigate

sentences.english: A few years later I was exploring the ruins of a hilltop temple in Cambodia.
sentences.chinese: 几年后，我寻访了柬埔寨一座山顶寺庙的遗址。

sentences.english: In return for David, and discussions with President sun his recovery plan.
sentences.chinese: 国大伟寻访归来，和孙院长一起研讨自己的复苏计划。

sentences.english: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and make a careful search for the child.
sentences.chinese: 就差他们往伯利恒去，说，你们去仔细寻访那小孩子。

sentences.english: With an aching heart, he had revisited his beloved haunts.
sentences.chinese: 怀着哀痛的心情，他重新寻访了他所心爱的旧游地。

sentences.english: Let's take a trip to the mysterious Kanas Lake.
sentences.chinese: 让我们去寻访神秘的喀纳斯湖吧。

sentences.english: I will wear an iron mask, and only when armed and mailed shall I seek them.
sentences.chinese: 我要戴上铁铸的面具，披甲戴盔后寻访他们。

definition: to seek by inquiry or search/to call on/to visit
to interview people on the spot/to go around and make inquiries
to collect local cultural material (recording folk songs, taking photos etc)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
see 追根溯源[zhui1 gen1 su4 yuan2]
to study away from home or abroad (old)
to explore a mystery/to probe the unknown
to wander (typically of an errant priest)
to travel over land and water (idiom)
to go and inspect (a site)/to do an on-site survey
